title: Atomic Physics - wavelength of emitted photon

content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the wavelengths <math alttext="lambda sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="lambda sub Y" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>λ</mi> <mtext>Y</mtext> </msub> </math>, and <math alttext="lambda sub Z" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math> of the photons emitted during transitions <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="lambda sub X is greater than, open parenthesis, lambda sub Y equals lambda sub Z, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, lambda sub Y equals lambda sub Z, close parenthesis, is greater than lambda sub X" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub X is greater than lambda sub Y, which is greater than lambda sub Z" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub Z is greater than lambda sub Y, which is greater than lambda sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="lambda sub Z is greater than lambda sub Y, which is greater than lambda sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
